subject: NFC CHAMPS
event:
The Giants are going to the Superbowl!
 
The Giants are going to the Superbowl!!
 
The Giants are going to the Superbowl!!!
 
I feel bad for Brett Favre, who I've always liked, but...
 
THE GIANTS ARE GOING TO THE SUPERBOWL!!!!!

comments.upictitle: move along, nothing to see here.: splendor
comments.article: HURRAY! :D
Ya still screaming for the Hefty Lefty? ;)
comments.subject: So George. . .

comments.article:
The Starks would be proud.

I mean, it was an ice bowl, after all...

Maybe if the Giants win the Superbowl the Starks wont all die.


please let the Giants win, oh please please please....
I'll be rooting for your team in the Super Bowl I don't want the Pats to have a completely perfect season.

Even though they played the patriots reasonably well the previous time, they will probably get crushed this time. It seemed like that the patriots did not even try until the 4th quarter playing vanilla defenses for the majority of the game. As soon as they introduced random blitzing, eli became a wet paper bag.

They didn't try until the 4th quarter!? The Giants played too conservatively in the 4th quarter and Eli threw a pick into the green zone. I felt that the Giants should have beaten the Pats before week 17 and I feel that they should beat them now.

I'm not say this as some rabid homer. I've derided Eli and Coughlin all season, and last year. The team offense has been more reliable since Shockey got hurt and Bradshaw has emerged... and Plax's ankle isn't as bad as it has been. They've always had a very talented team, but now they have been playing smarter football.

Due credit to Reese. He's done a masterful job as GM, giving Gilbride, Spagnuolo and Coughlin the tools to work with. And maybe, his "skittish" remark has spurred Eli to play smarter and to not try to be a gunslinger at this level as he was in college.

That was a game for the ages. If Eli ends up a superstar, history will look back on this series of games as his emergence. It's too bad that Brett didn't have his A game; I couldn't tell if it was the weather or the Giants defense, but it wasn't really as close as the OT would indicate.

Even though I'm a West Coaster, I'll be 100% on the Giants' side in the SuperBowl. Go Giants!
comments.subject: great game

comments.article:
It was a good game (for the Giants at least). But no, not as close as the overtime makes it seem. The Packers had too many penalties and too many turnovers. That last interception in overtime. *headdesk* I was also getting crabby that they kept calling screens. They obviously weren't working so why were we running them. I think some of it was the cold. Back in the Early 1990's I was always saying,"When that Favre guy settles in and stops throwing all those interceptions he's going to be really good." Here we are like 16 years later. OY!

The think that impressed me the most was that the Eli hasn't had any interceptions in the post season. He did a great job with his team today. They all played well.

I'll be pulling for the Giants to win this SuperBowl too. Sooner or later the Pats have to lose. Now is as good a time as any. :)
comments.subject: Re: great game

comments.article: What goes around, comes around. Here is the perfect chance for the Giants to get revenge against the Cheatriots.
comments.subject: Karma

comments.article:
Revenge? For losing the 16th game of the season to the Pats when the game had no positional bearing on the playoffs? I don't think the Giants are playing with a huge chip on their shoulder because they lost that game...

That being said, if that Pats play their best football, New York won't stand a chance. If they play like they did yesterday, it'll be a competitive game, and either team could win.
comments.subject: Re: Karma

comments.article:
That was my second thought. My first was, "I bet work will want me to come in early because my manager will likely have called out due to celebrating."

I work at a B&N so my manager is what we call a lead, he works along side me. Just so it's clear as to why I'd be called to replace a manager.
Yeah! Was a great game by the giants! Going to be an awesome game against the Pats.

Cool, good luck to the Giants! I hope they kick arse!

(My team won our finals last season, so I'll pass some of my good luck on to you!)

comments.upictitle: Canary In A Coal Mine: Scrubs - JD - Unicorn
comments.article:
It's amazing and awesome and it's still sinking in and OMG!

(I'm a huge Giants fan and I also feel badly for Brett Favre - that man is a class act.)

Me too.

I hope in 2 weeks I can feel just as badly for another class act, Jr.
Twas an awesome game. GO GIANTS!
HOLY SHIT THAT WAS A FANTASTIC GAME!  And that last field goal!  WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

Eddie Murphy predicted it 20 years ago

~~

Prince Akeem: Sir, did you happen to catch the professional football contest on television last night?

Cleo McDowell: No, I didn't.

Prince Akeem: Oh sir, the Giants of New York took on the Packers of Green Bay. And in the end, the Giants triumphed by kicking an oblong ball made of pigskin through a big "H". It was a most ripping victory.

Cleo McDowell: Son.

Prince Akeem: Yes?

Cleo McDowell: If you want to keep working here, stay off the drugs.

Prince Akeem: Yes.

Glad you pulled out some good news this month, George.  And I look forward to going to work tomorrow, some people there are also bound to be pretty excited.  Especially the one or two who life in E. Rutherford, NJ.

\m/

rock on!

GO GO MANNING!

I knew you would be sooo happy.

The Giants really deserved the win. They played very well.

Favre, that interception in overtime was painful. I feel bad because what an ugly way to go out. I don't know for sure that this was his last season (the boy is OLD for the NFL).

So now we root for the Giants to win the Super Bowl. I hope the kicking conditions are better in AZ. I felt bad when your kicker whiffed twice in those back to back kicks. Now back a long while ago (like 18 years) didn't the Giants play the Bills in the Super Bowl? Didn't they lose cause the kicker missed the field goal? Can we not repeat that?

I'm almost afraid to root for them. I don't want to jinx them.

comments.upictitle: For all your sophisticated Cock-Tailing needs: ASOIAF-Jon&Ghost
comments.article: It was the Bills who lost, back in 1991, and Scott Norwood, the Buffalo kicker who missed. Wide right, right at the end of the game and the Giants won by 1 point.  If I'm not mistaken, they used that scenario in one of the Ace Ventura movies. :-P
yeah,you know, I'm not a big football fanatic, but I found myself in a bar playing pool, and watching the game thinking "George will be pleased hooray!"
hilarious icon you have thar.
WOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOO FINALLY! it's only been, what, how many years? I'm just glad Eli's playing so well lately.

8ish.

He's definitely improved.

Wow!

A Favre, Brady matchup would have been something. Oh well, by the way...

The Giants are going to the Superbowl!

Eli, thanks for making me eat crow. Tiki, thanks for retiring. Coughlin, thanks for adapting.

The Gints dominated as I thought they would. I guess I need to thank the Bears for game plan.

Wow!
comments.subject: And, there is joy in Gotham.

comments.article:
I was thinking all season I like this team way better WITHOUT Tiki. That guy... I think the Giants are a lot better with that kid on TE, Boss(?), then Jeremy "Big Mouth Never Wins" Shockey. Coughlin would have an easier time coaching this team without him and Boss has a big body with soft hands (and probably a much cheaper contract).

A big unsung hero must be thanked though... Michael Stahan's ex-wife. If she didn't win that "gigantic" settlement in her and Michael's divorce that was dragged across all the NY tabloids, wouldn't Stahan have retired? He kind of needed the money. Poor bastard. Last least he's going to the Superbowl now.
comments.subject: Re: And, there is joy in Gotham.
Re: And, there is joy in Gotham.
Re: And, there is joy in Gotham.

comments.article: Great win! Congrats. :D
I'm happy for you, but I still hope the Patriots win - just to wipe the smile off all those smirking Dolphin fans...
You needed some good news.  Sorry about Gus...  My family has been busy, going through something like that concerning my elderly aunt who is very ill..  May Gus's memory be eternal in your heart.
comments.subject: good news for you

comments.article: I'm devastated. Plaxico Burress made Al Harris look like a high school cornerback.  I hope this isn't it for Brett. The way this team is coming along I'd love to see him come back one more year.  This feeling sucks. It's not as bad as losing the Super Bowl in 98, but it's pretty freakin close. Good luck Giants, it's up to you to stop this evil juggernaut in New England.
comments.subject: WHY!!!!!!!!!

comments.article:
Yay!

*also feels a little bad for Favre*

I'm happy for you! I'm hoping this will put you in a generous frame of mind when penning my favorite characters.

If the Giants win the Super Bowl, Tyrion should be thrown a scrap of happiness. What say you, oh magnanimous one?
